trans-unit.source: Back up Windows Server or Windows Client files and folders to Azure | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Back up Windows Server or Windows Client files and folders to Azure | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Backup a Windows Server or Windows Client to Azure with this simple procedure.
trans-unit.target: Backup a Windows Server or Windows Client to Azure with this simple procedure.

trans-unit.source: You can backup Windows files and folders to the cloud in a few easy steps.
trans-unit.target: You can backup Windows files and folders to the cloud in a few easy steps.

trans-unit.source: Back up Windows Server or Windows Client files and folders to Azure
trans-unit.target: Back up Windows Server or Windows Client files and folders to Azure

trans-unit.source: It’s easy to back up Windows files and folders to Azure with this simple procedure.
trans-unit.target: It’s easy to back up Windows files and folders to Azure with this simple procedure.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't already done so, complete the [prerequisites](backup-configure-vault.md#before-you-start) to prepare your environment to back up your Windows machine before you proceed.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't already done so, complete the [prerequisites](backup-configure-vault.md#before-you-start) to prepare your environment to back up your Windows machine before you proceed.

trans-unit.source: Back up files and folders
trans-unit.target: Back up files and folders

trans-unit.source: Once the machine is registered, open the Microsoft Azure Backup mmc snap-in.
trans-unit.target: Once the machine is registered, open the Microsoft Azure Backup mmc snap-in.

trans-unit.source: Search result
trans-unit.target: Search result

trans-unit.source: Click **Schedule Backup**
trans-unit.target: Click **Schedule Backup**

trans-unit.source: Schedule a Windows Server Backup
trans-unit.target: Schedule a Windows Server Backup

trans-unit.source: Select the items you wish to back up.
trans-unit.target: Select the items you wish to back up.

trans-unit.source: Azure Backup on a Windows Server/Windows Client (i.e
trans-unit.target: Azure Backup on a Windows Server/Windows Client (i.e

trans-unit.source: without System Center Data Protection Manager) enables you to protect files and folders.
trans-unit.target: without System Center Data Protection Manager) enables you to protect files and folders.

trans-unit.source: Items for Windows Server Backup
trans-unit.target: Items for Windows Server Backup

trans-unit.source: Specify the backup schedule and retention policy which is explained in detail in the following [article](backup-azure-backup-cloud-as-tape.md).
trans-unit.target: Specify the backup schedule and retention policy which is explained in detail in the following [article](backup-azure-backup-cloud-as-tape.md).

trans-unit.source: Choose the method for sending the initial backup.
trans-unit.target: Choose the method for sending the initial backup.

trans-unit.source: Your choice of completing the initial seeding is dependent on the amount of data you wish to back up and your internet upload link speed.
trans-unit.target: Your choice of completing the initial seeding is dependent on the amount of data you wish to back up and your internet upload link speed.

trans-unit.source: If you plan to back up GB’s/TB’s of data over a high latency, low bandwidth connection, it is recommended that you complete the initial backup by shipping a disk to the nearest Azure data center.
trans-unit.target: If you plan to back up GB’s/TB’s of data over a high latency, low bandwidth connection, it is recommended that you complete the initial backup by shipping a disk to the nearest Azure data center.

trans-unit.source: This is called “Offline Backup” and is covered in detail in this [article](backup-azure-backup-import-export.md).
trans-unit.target: This is called “Offline Backup” and is covered in detail in this [article](backup-azure-backup-import-export.md).

trans-unit.source: If you have a sufficient bandwidth connection we recommend that you complete the initial backup over the network.
trans-unit.target: If you have a sufficient bandwidth connection we recommend that you complete the initial backup over the network.

trans-unit.source: Initial Windows Server backup
trans-unit.target: Initial Windows Server backup

trans-unit.source: After the schedule backup process is completed, go back to the mmc snap in and click **Back up Now** to complete the initial seeding over the network.
trans-unit.target: After the schedule backup process is completed, go back to the mmc snap in and click **Back up Now** to complete the initial seeding over the network.

trans-unit.source: Windows Server backup now
trans-unit.target: Windows Server backup now

trans-unit.source: After the initial seeding is completed, the **Jobs** view in the Azure Backup console indicates the status.
trans-unit.target: After the initial seeding is completed, the **Jobs** view in the Azure Backup console indicates the status.

trans-unit.source: IR complete
trans-unit.target: IR complete

trans-unit.source: Next Steps
trans-unit.target: Next Steps

trans-unit.source: Manage Windows Server or Windows Client
trans-unit.target: Manage Windows Server or Windows Client

trans-unit.source: Restore Windows Server or Windows Client from Azure
trans-unit.target: Restore Windows Server or Windows Client from Azure

trans-unit.source: Azure Backup FAQ
trans-unit.target: Azure Backup FAQ

trans-unit.target: Visit the [Azure Backup Forum](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=290933)
